content: Bank Account Savings Lifestyle Asked by AnonymousAsked on 05 Sep 2019How will it be reflected if I credit USD in my DBS Multiplier account?Since it's a multi-currency account as what I read, will it be reflected in USD? And how do I change it to SGD? Thanks!1 answerAnswerBump0
Answers (1)Sort By Most UpvoteMost UpvoteMost Recent

Cedric Jamie Soh, Director at Seniorcare.com.sgTop Contributor (Sep)Level 7. Grand MasterAnswered on 10 Sep 2019In your internet banking of DBS, you will see 2 different currencies balance for your DBS Multiplier Account1 will be for SGD1 will be for USD(if you have the other currencies, it will show up too)Do note that when depositing USD cheques to your DBS, at the back do write down for USD account for DBS multiple currencies.Bank tellers may accidentally convert your USD to SGD and credit as SGD for you.0 comments1
